title: Customize the login and logout pages
content:
As a suite administrator, you can configure the theme settings of the login and logout pages for each tenant to suit your company's look and feel.

Customize the login and logout page appearance

This figure shows the customizable elements:

 
Currently, the copyright text can't be customized.

To customize the elements of an organization's login and logout pages:

  1. Click the IdM settings tab on the tenant details page from Suite Administration. This takes you to the IdM Admin Portal.
  2. Select an organization and choose Customization > BASIC.
  3. Configure the following elements as required and save the changes.
    • Choose Setting Language: This determines the language locale of elements you can localize (these elements are identifiable on the Customization page by a language code after the corresponding setting). Supported languages include English, German, Spanish, French, Japanese, and Chinese. For example, select Spanish in the drop-down list to configure the appearance of the login page when users log on with a browser that has the language set to Spanish. If you don't configure an element for a certain language, the login page shows the English setting by default.
    • Theme Name: The optional values are dark and light. The default theme is empty and will automatically switch between dark and light mode based on the system theme.
    • Login Form Background Color: Set login form background color in hexadecimal format which starts with #, such as #222428. The default value is empty.
    • Login Form Opacity (0-100): Set login form background opacity in percentage. The valid value ranges from 0 to 100. The default value is empty.
    • Portal Title: Specify the portal title for the current organization. 

       

       
      There are two levels of Portal Title settings, an organizational level and a global level. The organizational level setting in Organizations > Customizations > Basic updates the portal title for the current organization. The global level setting in GLOBAL SETTINGS > System Settings > Others > Portal Title updates the portal title for all the organizations in the system.

      If you don't set the organizational level Portal Title, it will take the value from GLOBAL SETTINGS > System Settings > Others > Portal Title. If you configure both the organizational level and the global level settings, the organizational level setting takes priority.

    • Application Version Label: Specify the application version that is displayed next to the Portal Title. 

       

       
      There are two levels of Application Version Label settings, an organizational level and a global level. If you configure both the organizational level and the global level settings, the organizational level setting takes priority.

      If you've defined a new Portal Title, Application Version Label will take the organizational level setting, no matter if it's empty or not. The global level setting will be ignored.

    • Disclaimer Text: Specify the text for a disclaimer banner that's displayed before users can log in. The text can be up to 2,048 characters in length and supports the following HTML tags: <h1> through to <h6>, <br>, <li>, and <ul>.
    • Portal Footer Message: Specify the portal footer message. You must specify the Portal Footer Message to display the footer message you configured.
    • Show Portal Legal Notice: Select this option if you want to display a legal notice in the footer.
    • Portal Legal Notice URL: If you have selected to display a legal notice, use this option to specify the URL where you saved the legal notice image.
    • Background Image URL: Specify the URL where you saved the background image. You can also select the Set Picture By Uploading to upload a local image.

       

       

      There are two levels of Background Image settings, an organizational level and a global level. The organizational level setting in Organizations > Customizations > Basic updates the background image for the current organization. The global level setting in GLOBAL SETTINGS > System Settings > Others > Global Background Image updates the background image as default value for all the organizations in the system. If you configure both the organizational level and the global level settings, the organizational level setting takes priority. 

      Global Background Image and IdM Global Icon impacts all of the tenant irrelevant error pages as well such as the invalid_token, invalid_tenant, and unavailable.

    • Popup Page Icon URL: Specify the URL where you saved the icon that's displayed as the company logo on pages such as the login page, the logout page, and the error page. You can also select the Set picture by uploading to upload a local image. It's the icon for the login and logout page.

       

       
      There are two levels of Popup Page Icon settings, an organizational level Popup Page Icon URL and a global level IdM Global Icon. If you configure both the organizational level and the global level settings, the organizational level setting takes priority.

      Global Background Image and IdM Global Icon impacts all of the tenant irrelevant error pages as well such as the invalid_token, invalid_tenant, and unavailable.

       

       
      The popup page icon will be displayed only when the Background Image URL is set. Use images with a resolution of (48 ~ 320) * 64 pixels for the popup page icon logo. The maximum image size allowed for the background image, and popup page icon shouldn't exceed 10MB.
